sen.j: 学問所（がくもんじょ）とは、中世・近世における教育機関の名称の1つ。
sen.e: Gakumonjo (a school) was one of the names of educational institutions in medieval and modern times.
Gakumonjo (a school) was the name of a kind of educational institution in medieval and modern times.
Gakumonjo (a school) was the name of a kind of educational institution in medieval and modern times.

sen.j: 元は、個人所有の書斎・書庫の意味で用いられていたが、鎌倉時代以後に学問教授の場所としても用いられるようになった。
sen.e: Originally, 'gakumonjo' referred to a personally-owned study or library, but after the Kamakura period, people came to use gakumonjo as a place to instruct academics.

sen.j: 建保元年（1213年）に鎌倉幕府征夷大将軍源実朝の学問所の警備と学友を兼ねた学問所番18名（6名ずつ3番）が設置された。
sen.e: In 1213, eighteen guards of gakumonjo (three groups of six) were deployed who would play the roles of not only the guards of the gakumonjo owned by Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians) of the Kamakura bakufu MINAMOTO no Sanetomo but also fellow students.

sen.j: そして、北条泰時・安達景盛・島津忠久らが任じられている（『吾妻鏡』）。
sen.e: And Yasutomo HOJO, Kagemori ADACHI, Tadahisa SHIMAZU and other were appointed ("Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East)).

sen.j: 書院造が成立すると、書斎・書庫などの書室を特に学問所と呼称した。
sen.e: With the establishment of Shoin-zukuri style, shoshitsu (study) such as shosai (study) and library came to be called gakumonjo.
With the establishment of the Shoin-zukuri style, book repositories such as shosai (a study) and libraries came to be called gakumonjo.

sen.j: 江戸時代には、江戸幕府が設置した昌平坂学問所の略称として知られた他、江戸幕府が設置した学校や諸藩の藩校の中にもこの名称が採用されるものがあった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, 'gakumonjo' was known as the abbreviation of Shoheizaka Gakumonjo (Shoheizaka school) established by the Edo bakufu, and in addition, the name was adopted by some of the schools established by the Edo bakufu and hanko (domain schools) owned by domains.
